values.description:
Homebrew allows bottles to be specified for a range of distros when appropriate by appending `_or_later` to the distro symbol in the formula. I'm using this in ignition-cmake, but we need some extra logic in the bottle pull request script.

* PR updating ignition-cmake: https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/289
* bottle build successful: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/237

I'll add another test with a formula that doesn't use `_or_later` to confirm that it doesn't break things.
values.title: update brew bottles that have an or_later symbol

summary.raw:
Homebrew allows bottles to be specified for a range of distros when appropriate by appending `_or_later` to the distro symbol in the formula. I'm using this in ignition-cmake, but we need some extra logic in the bottle pull request script.

* PR updating ignition-cmake: https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/289
* bottle build successful: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/237

I'll add another test with a formula that doesn't use `_or_later` to confirm that it doesn't break things.
summary.html:
Homebrew allows bottles to be specified for a range of distros when appropriate by appending _or_later to the distro symbol in the formula. I'm using this in ignition-cmake, but we need some extra logic in the bottle pull request script.

  • PR updating ignition-cmake: https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/289
  • bottle build successful: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/237

I'll add another test with a formula that doesn't use _or_later to confirm that it doesn't break things.

values.description:
We use the brew formula to resolve dependencies in our CI, but sometimes there are different dependencies for different major versions of a package. For example, gazebo, sdformat, and ign-transport have scripts in release-tools that detect this manually, though most of the ignition packages don't have custom scripts; they just use the generic `project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bash` script.

As we are planning to add dependencies on `ign-cmake` to the ignition packages now, I'm adding some major version detection for packages that use `ign-cmake` to the generic script so we don't need to make a bunch more CI scripts for each ignition package. Also, I delete the custom ign-math script since it's not needed anymore.

Tested with ign-math:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/192/
values.title: detect major version for ignition packages that use ign-cmake

values.description:
In a recent [pull request to update homebrew bottles](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/290), the bottle metadata for ignition-transport2 was removed to indicate that we won't build bottles for it anymore. The [bottle builder job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-sierra/80) completed successfully, but the [bottle pull request updater failed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/253) since it couldn't find the metadata for ignition-transport2 bottle to update. Fortunately it had already committed the updates for 3 formulae, but it missed the last one.

This PR will allow loop to continue instead of exiting and mark the build as unstable if a formula isn't updated.

Testing with this bottle build:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-highsierra/34/
values.title: homebrew bottle pull request: continue on failure instead of exit

summary.raw:

The [bottle builder job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-sierra/80) completed successfully, but the [bottle pull request updater failed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pr_bottle_hash_updater/253) since it couldn't find the metadata for ignition-transport2 bottle to update. Fortunately it had already committed the updates for 3 formulae, but it missed the last one.

This PR will allow loop to continue instead of exiting and mark the build as unstable if a formula isn't updated.

Testing with this bottle build:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-highsierra/34/
summary.html:
In a recent pull request to update homebrew bottles, the bottle metadata for ignition-transport2 was removed to indicate that we won't build bottles for it anymore. The bottle builder job completed successfully, but the bottle pull request updater failed since it couldn't find the metadata for ignition-transport2 bottle to update. Fortunately it had already committed the updates for 3 formulae, but it missed the last one.

This PR will allow loop to continue instead of exiting and mark the build as unstable if a formula isn't updated.

Testing with this bottle build:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-highsierra/34/

values.description:
An ignition-msgs homebrew build with the branch moving ign-msgs1 to use ign-cmake failed because it installed to an unversioned folder and `brew doctor` expected different dependencies to be installed because the unversioned ignition-msgs alias points to major version 0:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/10

Using the versioned `PROJECT_FORMULA` variable in a few more places, fixes this failure:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/11
values.title: brew: use versioned PROJECT_FORMULA more to fix brew doctor after brew link

values.description:
Gazebo has a lot of flaky tests, so we added a script for running failed tests a second time on homebrew in the following pull requests:

* pull request #209
* pull request #356
* pull request #434

This pull request adds this behavior to our Linux gazebo builds in docker. Since the base gazebo script invokes `make test` separately for each type of test, I've enabled re-running failed tests only for `INTEGRATION_` and `REGRESSION_` tests, presuming that `UNIT_` and `EXAMPLE_` tests shouldn't be flaky.

I have tested with the following two builds:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65

The first build had no listed test failures, but two flaky tests:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_PhysicsFrictionTest/MaximumDissipation_0/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_SimEventsTest/ModelInAnOutOfRegion_0/

In the second build, [one unit test failed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/UNIT_SonarSensor_TEST/), the [WorldRemove test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) seg-faulted at first, then passed on its second try, and the [ContactSensor integration test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_ContactSensor/) failed on its first run then seg-faulted on its second chance.
values.title: Rerun failed integration and regression tests in gazebo on linux

summary.raw:
Gazebo has a lot of flaky tests, so we added a script for running failed tests a second time on homebrew in the following pull requests:

* pull request #209
* pull request #356
* pull request #434

This pull request adds this behavior to our Linux gazebo builds in docker. Since the base gazebo script invokes `make test` separately for each type of test, I've enabled re-running failed tests only for `INTEGRATION_` and `REGRESSION_` tests, presuming that `UNIT_` and `EXAMPLE_` tests shouldn't be flaky.

I have tested with the following two builds:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65

The first build had no listed test failures, but two flaky tests:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_PhysicsFrictionTest/MaximumDissipation_0/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_SimEventsTest/ModelInAnOutOfRegion_0/

In the second build, [one unit test failed](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/UNIT_SonarSensor_TEST/), the [WorldRemove test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/WorldRemoveTest_WorldRemoveTest/) seg-faulted at first, then passed on its second try, and the [ContactSensor integration test](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_ContactSensor/) failed on its first run then seg-faulted on its second chance.
summary.html:
Gazebo has a lot of flaky tests, so we added a script for running failed tests a second time on homebrew in the following pull requests:

  • pull request #209
  • pull request #356
  • pull request #434

This pull request adds this behavior to our Linux gazebo builds in docker. Since the base gazebo script invokes make test separately for each type of test, I've enabled re-running failed tests only for INTEGRATION_ and REGRESSION_ tests, presuming that UNIT_ and EXAMPLE_ tests shouldn't be flaky.

I have tested with the following two builds:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/65

The first build had no listed test failures, but two flaky tests:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_PhysicsFrictionTest/MaximumDissipation_0/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTDebug-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_SimEventsTest/ModelInAnOutOfRegion_0/

In the second build, one unit test failed, the WorldRemove test seg-faulted at first, then passed on its second try, and the ContactSensor integration test failed on its first run then seg-faulted on its second chance.

values.description:
While updating jenkins to use Visual Studio 2017, I took the opportunity to reevaluate some of the ways our Windows CI is set up. It seemed rather onerous that the `release-tools` repo needed to be updated any time the dependencies of an ignition project get changed. This is especially problematic if different branches of a project have different dependencies.

This PR allows `release-tools` to be more generic on the Windows CI. Instead of dependencies being handled inside `release-tools`, they will be handled within the `configure.bat` file of each project (which can be changed between branches), and `release-tools` will provide some scripting helpers to make it easy for the individual `configure.bat` files to specify what their dependencies are and how to install them. That way `release-tools` can remain completely stable, even as projects' dependencies change over time.

There are three projects with pull requests that are associated with this proposal:

1. [ign-cmake](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/6/)
2. [ign-math](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/204/)
3. [ign-common](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/82/)

I recommend we wait until all of the related PRs are approved and merge them all simultaneously in order to have the least amount of friction in the CI.

Note that the CI for all of `ign-cmake`, `ign-math`, and `ign-common` will now go through the `jenkins-scripts/lib/generic-default-devel-windows.bat` instead of needing their own setup scripts.

For projects that have not yet migrated, I've attempted to preserve backwards compatibility, but it may be a good idea to test your existing project against this branch to make sure it isn't doing something harmful.
values.title: Proposal: Updating to Visual Studio 2017 and improving Windows CI

summary.html:
While updating jenkins to use Visual Studio 2017, I took the opportunity to reevaluate some of the ways our Windows CI is set up. It seemed rather onerous that the release-tools repo needed to be updated any time the dependencies of an ignition project get changed. This is especially problematic if different branches of a project have different dependencies.

This PR allows release-tools to be more generic on the Windows CI. Instead of dependencies being handled inside release-tools, they will be handled within the configure.bat file of each project (which can be changed between branches), and release-tools will provide some scripting helpers to make it easy for the individual configure.bat files to specify what their dependencies are and how to install them. That way release-tools can remain completely stable, even as projects' dependencies change over time.

There are three projects with pull requests that are associated with this proposal:

  1. ign-cmake
  2. ign-math
  3. ign-common

I recommend we wait until all of the related PRs are approved and merge them all simultaneously in order to have the least amount of friction in the CI.

Note that the CI for all of ign-cmake, ign-math, and ign-common will now go through the jenkins-scripts/lib/generic-default-devel-windows.bat instead of needing their own setup scripts.

For projects that have not yet migrated, I've attempted to preserve backwards compatibility, but it may be a good idea to test your existing project against this branch to make sure it isn't doing something harmful.

* Handsim/Haptix project related
* gazebo\_ardupilot
* Robocup3ds
* sandia-hand, osrf-common from DRCSim
* Gazebo chroot old scripts already migrated to docker

values.description:
The sdformat windows build has been failing on the default branch:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-default-windows7-amd64/93/

It tries to use the version of ignition-math listed as required in the cmake/SearchForStuff. Since the `ign-math4` branch now uses `ign-cmake`, the build is broken because the configure scripts are out of date. This fixes the build by hard-coding the use of `ign-math3` and should be reverted once we fix the configure scripts.
values.title: sdformat windows script: hard-code ign-math3 for now until we fix configure scripts

summary.raw:
The sdformat windows build has been failing on the default branch:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-default-windows7-amd64/93/

It tries to use the version of ignition-math listed as required in the cmake/SearchForStuff. Since the `ign-math4` branch now uses `ign-cmake`, the build is broken because the configure scripts are out of date. This fixes the build by hard-coding the use of `ign-math3` and should be reverted once we fix the configure scripts.
summary.html:
The sdformat windows build has been failing on the default branch:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/sdformat-ci-default-windows7-amd64/93/

It tries to use the version of ignition-math listed as required in the cmake/SearchForStuff. Since the ign-math4 branch now uses ign-cmake, the build is broken because the configure scripts are out of date. This fixes the build by hard-coding the use of ign-math3 and should be reverted once we fix the configure scripts.

values.description:
We changed the syntax of ignition-cmake in a [recent pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/13/we-now-require-a-literal-call-to-project/diff), which broke the way I was detecting major versions in our homebrew CI. This is an attempt to fix that.

* broken: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/101/
* also broken: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/102/
* 51dde4f
* fixed: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/103/

values.description:
Improve version update logic in homebrew_formula_pullrequest.bash to handle case when explicit version tag should be removed after update to a URL with auto-detectable version

* formula update with unneeded explicit version tag: https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/326 caused [failed bottle builds](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder-sierra/124/)
* retry with this branch: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_pull_request_updater/193/, [new homebrew pr](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/327)

values.description:
We haven't been using the `--HEAD` option for homebrew for a while. I was testing ignition-common recently to see the impact of a new tinyxml2 version, and it failed to install some of the `--HEAD` dependencies:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/88/

Using this branch, it installs those dependencies successfully, but fails to compile due to a tinyxml2 API change:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/89
values.title: don't use --HEAD when installing homebrew dependencies

values.description:
if the homebrew one-liner installation script fails, then brew wouldn't be reinstalled, leading to other jobs failing

so reinstall it just after the cleanup and before the one-liner

* Linux CI [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_fuel-tools-ci-default-xenial-amd64/8/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-xenial-amd64/8/)

* Debbuilder [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign-fuel-tools-debbuilder/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign-fuel-tools-debbuilder/) \+ release repository [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools-release](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools-release)

There are experimental packages in our prerelease repository.

Still to be implemented is the Windows CI, we need to package the external dependencies to MSVC17.

summary.html:

  • Linux CI https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-xenial-amd64/8/
  • Mac CI https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/4/
  • Debbuilder https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign-fuel-tools-debbuilder/ + release repository https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools-release

There are experimental packages in our prerelease repository.

Still to be implemented is the Windows CI, we need to package the external dependencies to MSVC17.

values.description:
@chapulina were a bit confused today when trying to figure out why the [ignition_fuel-tools-ci-pr_any](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-pr_any) job wasn't setting the build status properly. It turns out that I had set the `JENKINS_BUILD_REPO` variable with a trailing slash like `https://bitbucket.org/scpeters/ign-cmake/`, but there was a regex that didn't like that in the `_bitbucket_set_status.bash` script.

* [failure without this branch](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/8325)
* [success with this branch](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/8324/)

I also noticed that the list of values for the `BITBUCKET_STATUS` variable was incorrect and fixed that too.
values.title: Handle trailing slashes in repo variable for bitbucket set status job

summary.raw:
@chapulina were a bit confused today when trying to figure out why the [ignition_fuel-tools-ci-pr_any](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_fuel-tools-ci-pr_any) job wasn't setting the build status properly. It turns out that I had set the `JENKINS_BUILD_REPO` variable with a trailing slash like `https://bitbucket.org/scpeters/ign-cmake/`, but there was a regex that didn't like that in the `_bitbucket_set_status.bash` script.

* [failure without this branch](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/8325)
* [success with this branch](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_bitbucket-set_status/8324/)

I also noticed that the list of values for the `BITBUCKET_STATUS` variable was incorrect and fixed that too.
summary.html:
@chapulina were a bit confused today when trying to figure out why the ignition_fuel-tools-ci-pr_any job wasn't setting the build status properly. It turns out that I had set the JENKINS_BUILD_REPO variable with a trailing slash like https://bitbucket.org/scpeters/ign-cmake/, but there was a regex that didn't like that in the _bitbucket_set_status.bash script.

  • failure without this branch
  • success with this branch

I also noticed that the list of values for the BITBUCKET_STATUS variable was incorrect and fixed that too.

values.description:
The PR implements two jobs for testing the implementation of the ROS wrapper for Drake:

* Testing job: install the drake repository for drake and ros-kinetic-ros-drake packages. Once the installation is ready, compile kumunoito in a catkin workspace.
* Bloom debbuilder for ros\_drake: job for generating the .debs from the results of bloom the ros\_drake package 

Some shared code has been moved to lib/drake. The PR adds a hook to debian-git-debbuilder to be able to run code before the creation of the .debs.

Tested:

* [Install job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ros_drake-install-xenial-amd64/22/)
* [Bloom debbuilder](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ros-drake-bloom-debbuilder/)
values.title: ROS Drake: testing catkin job and bloom debbuilder

summary.raw:
The PR implements two jobs for testing the implementation of the ROS wrapper for Drake:

* Testing job: install the drake repository for drake and ros-kinetic-ros-drake packages. Once the installation is ready, compile kumunoito in a catkin workspace.
* Bloom debbuilder for ros\_drake: job for generating the .debs from the results of bloom the ros\_drake package 

Some shared code has been moved to lib/drake. The PR adds a hook to debian-git-debbuilder to be able to run code before the creation of the .debs.

Tested:

* [Install job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ros_drake-install-xenial-amd64/22/)
* [Bloom debbuilder](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ros-drake-bloom-debbuilder/)
summary.html:
The PR implements two jobs for testing the implementation of the ROS wrapper for Drake:

  • Testing job: install the drake repository for drake and ros-kinetic-ros-drake packages. Once the installation is ready, compile kumunoito in a catkin workspace.
  • Bloom debbuilder for ros_drake: job for generating the .debs from the results of bloom the ros_drake package

Some shared code has been moved to lib/drake. The PR adds a hook to debian-git-debbuilder to be able to run code before the creation of the .debs.

Tested:

  • Install job
  • Bloom debbuilder

values.description:
Since pull request #462 was merged, the [gazebo homebrew build is broken](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/285/). It seems to be sending the `"--with-ffmpeg --with-bullet --with-simbody"` arguments to `make test`, but I don't understand why the arguments are passed across nested script calls. I'm just removing these arguments since they aren't needed anymore since bullet, ffmpeg, and simbody are now default dependencies.

testing here:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/285/
values.title: fix gazebo make test by removing unused PROJECT_ARGS

It seems to be sending the `"--with-ffmpeg --with-bullet --with-simbody"` arguments to `make test`, but I don't understand why the arguments are passed across nested script calls. I'm just removing these arguments since they aren't needed anymore since bullet, ffmpeg, and simbody are now default dependencies.

I'm just removing these arguments since they aren't needed anymore since bullet, ffmpeg, and simbody are now default dependencies.
